prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8.
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: ...I was in Lobby No. 1... talking with Yew.
Person: Badd
Testimony 1
Testimony: ...We were talking about... some trivial things.
Person: Badd
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I heard the gunshot... right before the trial was about to reconvene.
Person: Badd
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I didn't hear any other strange sounds... until that gunshot...
Person: Badd
Testimony 4
Testimony: When we heard it, Yew and I immediately dashed out into the hallway together!
Person: Badd
Testimony 5
Testimony: I saw Gumshoe goofing around there... and then we all ran in to Lobby No. 2.
Person: Badd

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to tackle this problem step by step. So, I've got this list of characters, evidences, and testimonies from a murder case involving the Embassy staff killing. The main characters involved are Manfred von Karma, Byrne Faraday, Mack Rell, Yatagarasu, Kay Faraday, the Judge, Dick Gumshoe, Calisto Yew, Tyrell Badd, Manny Coachen, and Franziska von Karma.

First, I need to understand what each piece of evidence and testimony is saying. The key evidence here includes things like the Prosecutor's Badge, the KG-8 Incident Overview, Det. Gumshoe's Testimony, the Handgun, Knife, Crime Scene Notes, Plastic Bag, Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen, Annual Bonus Envelope, Swiss Roll, Det. Badd's Testimony, Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints, Balloon Piece, Promise Notebook, Ms. Yew's Perfume, Mr. Faraday's Organizer, Yatagarasu's Key, and Surveillance Video.

The testimonies are from various characters, mainly about the events surrounding the murder, the movements of suspects, and the evidence found at the crime scene.

Now, the question is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to find a pair where one piece of evidence supports one version of events, while another testimony contradicts it.

Looking at the testimonies, I see that Tyrell Badd testified about hearing a gunshot and seeing Yew and him dash out into the hallway. He also mentioned seeing Dick Gumshoe in the hallway before the gunshot. On the other hand, the evidence includes the Surveillance Video, which apparently shows the gunshot as especially impactful, and the Crime Scene Notes, which mention that the bodies fell into a pile, indicating they attacked each other at the same time.

So, the contradiction seems to be between the testimony of Badd and the evidence from the Surveillance Video and Crime Scene Notes. Badd said he heard the gunshot and saw others react, while the evidence suggests that the victims attacked each other simultaneously, which doesn't align with Badd's account of hearing a single gunshot and seeing a reaction.

Therefore, the evidence that contradicts the testimony is Evidence 17 (Surveillance Video) and Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) contradicting Testimony 2 and Testimony 3 from Tyrell Badd.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this scenario. There's a lot going on here, so I need to take it step by step.

First, let me look at the characters involved. There's Manfred von Karma, a legendary prosecutor; Byrne Faraday, a prosecutor involved in an embassy staff killing case; Deid Mann, an embassy staff member who was gunned down; Mack Rell, a suspect in that case; Yatagarasu, a mysterious thief who infiltrated the embassy; Kay Faraday, a girl with a balloon who asked for change; The Judge, the judge in the case; Dick Gumshoe, a rookie detective; Calisto Yew, a lawyer defending Rell; Tyrell Badd, an eagle-eyed homicide detective; Manny Coachen, an embassy staff member involved in the KG-8 incident; and Franziska von Karma, Manfred's daughter.

Now, looking at the evidences, there's a lot of physical evidence like the Prosecutor's Badge, the KG-8 Incident Overview, Det. Gumshoe's Testimony, the Handgun, Knife, Crime Scene Notes, Plastic Bag, Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen, Annual Bonus Envelope, Swiss Roll, Det. Badd's Testimony, Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints, Balloon Piece, Promise Notebook, Ms. Yew's Perfume, Mr. Faraday's Organizer, Yatagarasu's Key, and Surveillance Video.

The testimonies include statements from various characters, like Yew accusing someone of murder over a perfume spill, Badd talking about hearing a gunshot, and others.

Now, I need to find a pair where evidence contradicts testimony. Let's see.

Starting with the Surveillance Video (Evidence 17), it's mentioned as video evidence of the Embassy staff member's murder, with a particularly impactful gunshot. That seems like it would support the testimony from Det. Badd (Testimony 10) who heard the gunshot before the trial reconvened. But maybe the Surveillance Video shows something else, like the lack of a struggle or the position of the body, contradicting Badd's testimony.

Alternatively, looking at the Knife (Evidence 4), it's described as a weapon used to kill Faraday, found in Rell's hand. If the Knife has a secret ability to transform into a key, that might not align with it being used as a murder weapon, which could contradict the testimony from Yew (Testimony 4) who claims it's just a key.

But the more obvious contradiction seems to be between the Surveillance Video and Det. Badd's testimony. If the video shows that there was no struggle or that the position of the body doesn't support Badd's account, that would directly contradict his testimony.

So, the evidence that contradicts the testimony would be Evidence 17 (Surveillance Video) contradicting Testimony 10 (Det. Badd's Testimony).
</think>
